required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Eluting Balloon Efficacy for Small Coronary Vessel Disease Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Impiego Del Pallone Medicato Per il Trattamento di Piccoli Vasi Coronarici in Confronto Con Stent Medicato - Drug Eluting Balloon Efficacy for Small Coronary Vessel Disease Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multicentre, randomized clinical study of consecutive patients with coronary artery disease in vessels with diameter ≤2.75 mm. Patients will be randomized to drug-eluting balloon (DEB) or standard therapy with second generation drug-eluting stent (DES). Study population will consist of 240 patients with stable or unstable angina

primary_outcome.description: the primary objective of the study is the non-inferiority of the DCB compared to DES in terms of absence of restenosis, defined as reoccurrence of stenoses of at least 50% of the lumen of the vessel at angiographic follow-up (6 months after surgery).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with changes of vessels lumen
secondary_outcome.description: any differences between groups in terms of vascular changes to angiography.
changes of concentration in blood chemistry between the groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: appearance of major cardiovascular adverse events

arm_group.description: standard therapy with second generation drug-eluting stent (DES)

intervention.description: Patients will be randomized to drug-eluting balloon (DEB) or standard therapy with second generation drug-eluting stent (DES)
Patients will be randomized to drug-eluting balloon (DEB) or standard therapy with second generation drug-eluting stent (DES).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Age >18 years.
2. Stable or unstable coronary artery disease.
3. Native coronary artery lesion in vessel with diameter <2.75 mm.
4. Clinical indication to percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).
Exclusion criteria
1. Enrolment in another study with any investigational drug or device.
2. Acute or recent (≤48 hours) myocardial infarction.
3. Creatinine clearance <50 ml/min.
4. Left ventricle ejection fraction <30%.
5. Any known allergy, hypersensitivity or intolerance to any drug used during or after the procedure.
6. Heavily calcified and severely tortuous lesions.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, A.O. Fatebenefratelli Milano, Italy
